title: KashFlow coming up blank
content: I am trying to log on to KashFlow which I use for work. The logon screens are working fine but once I have logged in I am getting a blank window. The browser bar reads https://app.kashflow.com/#login and doesn't change or move on. I have tried logging on with add-ons turned off. I have checked my Firefox is up to date and rebooted my laptop. All worked fine on Sunday 1st Nov when I last used it. I can login fine and work as normal if I use Google Chrome... which is not my preferred browser obviously! Any advice, thanks?
creator: berri1

title: Firefox no me deja elegir Certificados digitales instalados, selecciona el por defecto
content:
Buenos días, 

    Tengo instalado el Firefox 82.0.2 (64-bit) y tengo instalado 3 certificados digitales. Voy al apartado de CERTIFICADOS y tengo activado "PREGUNTAR CADA VEZ" y tambien tengo activad "Consultar a los servidores respondedores OCSP para confirmar la validez actual de los certificados"....  
    Cada vez que entro a la web de administracion publica, por defecto entro con el primer certificado instalado y no me deja elegir los otros certificados. No tengo contraseña maestra activada.  
    Alguien me puede ayudar a solucionarlo?


Gracias

title: Firefox is suddenly and randomly shutting down for me as well.
content: Firefox just shuts down and when you reopen it the result is as others have reported - it lists the tabs that were open and you have to wait for the pages to rewrite. Some revert back to a log in screen but most go back to the screen when Firefox shuts down. There are no issues that are evident and nothing comes up in the alerts on my AV, etc. programs. It is really annoying when you have just logged into a mail program e. g. hotmail; aim; and it is in the private browser screen. This one does not reopen and you have to start from the beginning again. It has only been happening over the last week or so and can happen 2 or 3 times in a day, depending on how long the computer is being used - extended day or just a short few hours. There are no crash reports or error messages from Firefox. It just totally shuts down.
creator: ok007au

title: Firefox is blocking requests to a particular url on react app
content:

Also to be noted is that this happens only with one particular project and not with other projects. The same API works fine on Chrome.

OS: Ubuntu 20.04.1 LTS Browser: Mozilla Firefox for Ubuntu canonical-1.0 v82.0

title: Firefox & Collections
content:
Brandon Armstrong

xxxxxxxxx@xxxx.xxx xxxxxxx.xx.xx.xxxxx.xxx

Hi, I have a cheap Obama phone, ul40 and I only get 2G a month, it is several years old. So I will go to a free public WiFi place, spend a few hours downloading, then I go home and use a USB cable to transfer them to my old Dell home PC.

My phone has been acting up, so I factory reset it. I installed the Firefox browser, I like it because I could save web pages as a PDF.

I installed the new Firefox and had some problems. I saved a bunch of items, but when I linked to my PC there was only one item in downloads, everything else was now in Collections. Collections was new to me and I thought it was just labeling things.

(email address removed by moderator; please do not post personal information on a public website) I will check my phone's memory, I have dozens of items in Collections, I tap them and I can read the articles, but I can't seem to access them from my PC.

How do do this? Is there a way to go back to the previous...print, save as PDF, method? It seems like you fixed something that wasn't broken.

Frankly I don't know why there isn't a Save/Download button on display at all times when you see something interesting. What is the logic in starting to Print something, than previewing it, then saving the preview?

Sorry if I seem a bit irritated. Is it simply time to apply for a new phone?

Thanks, BA
creator: brandon.la.70

title: Since installing the late October update I'm having display issues in Newspaper (NYT and WaPo) sites.
content: The width of news columns have shrunk, and side columns like comments in New York Times have lost both width and height and are in smaller fonts. I normally run most web pages at 120-150% and the larger size seems to not passing on to the side columns. The column width issue also occurs on the Washington Post. The only change has been the Firefox update, and standard rebooting and troubleshooting makes no difference. I need to get back to the previous column and text sizes, including applying increased magnification. Is there any option short of trying to revert to the older version, which doesn't look easy.
creator: amoret

title: Firefox Window Position on Open
content: Why is it when I move the Firefox window to touch the taskbar, when I close and reopen Firefox, there is a 4-5px gap between the window border and the taskbar? This triggers my mild OCD like no other. Other browsers don't have this issue - so why Firefox?

title: Recover Deleted Firefox Browsing History
content:
Regarding "Recover Deleted Firefox Browsing History"

I ran CCleaner software and it deleted all my history on general PC Health checkup & fix without my knowledge it would do so. I need to get them back. I use Windows 7 Home Premium.

I have reviewed the answers given on this by helpers back in July 2020 but I am unclear on where to find the index.dat file they mention. The instructions given there about going thru START etc and changing what files are visible on C drive I assume relate to Windows folder options ??????? Yes / No ? (Where is this Start button because the bottom left of screen one doesnt run the search sequence they mentioned).

Exactly what folder is the backup saved index.dat file in ?

Then using the index.dat viewer which file do I copy its information to ?

Can someone give a clear concise step by step description on recovery of the lost browsing history.

I would also comment Firefox ought to have an recovery button for accidentally deleted history to save having to go thru all this
creator: superguy55
